title: Describing the Nature of an Association
question_text:
A study was designed to measure the association between adults' resting pulse and their exercise pulse, which were both measured in beats per minute (bpm). Subjects measured their resting pulse for one minute. They then ran on a treadmill for two minutes and measured their exercise pulse immediately after for one minute.

Which of the following describes the nature of the association between adults' resting pulses and their exercise pulses?

choices.text: There is a moderately strong negative linear association between resting pulse and exercise pulse among adults.
There is a moderately strong positive linear association between resting pulse and exercise pulse among adults.
There is a weak negative linear association between resting pulse and exercise pulse among adults.
There is a weak positive linear association between resting pulse and exercise pulse among adults.
There is relatively strong positive non-linear association between resting pulse and exercise pulse among adults.
